result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jason Lamar Smith

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Jason Lamar Smith appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Scott Alan Wales Aty in court for Jason Lamar Smith.  Attorney Julie Knyszek for Jessica Bellows in court for State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm 
Case calendared for Motion to Withdraw as Defense cannot meet Defendant's request for a speedy trial.  Court grants Defense motion to withdraw.  Defendant to be produced for the next court date.  Court sets matter for State v Lee Hearing.
Hearing scheduled for December 14, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Jason Lamar Smith not in court, in custody.  Attorney Scott Alan Wales Aty in court for Jason Lamar Smith.  Prosecuting attorney Jessica Bellows in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm 
Court in trial on another matter.  Case heard off the record.  Due to the State Public Defender failing to timely appoint counsel, the court appointed counsel at Milwaukee County expense.  Attorney Scott Wales accepts appointment.
Status conference scheduled for December 1, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Jason Lamar Smith in court, in custody.  Attorney Jessica Bellows in court for State of Wisconsin.  Thomas Reed in court on behalf of the State Public Defender's Office. 
Case in court for a State V. Lee hearing. The public defender's office did not appoint counsel at this time and requests additional time to appoint counsel. Court grants and additional 3 weeks to appoint. Court remains calendared in Branch 12.
Status conference scheduled for October 4, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Jason Lamar Smith appeared by video, in custody in HOC.  Prosecuting attorney Abby Rockendorf in court in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case is set for Status Conference. SPD has not appointed counsel. Case is adjourned. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE to the trial court for a State V. Lee Hearing. Matter to be heard in Br. 12 for Br. 19 on the next date due to following the defendant's lower pending matter 21CF5153. 
Hearing scheduled for September 6, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Jason Lamar Smith not in court, defendant in custody at HOC.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case is set for a Status Conference. Case is adjourned. SPD has failed to appoint counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Status Of Counsel.  Status conference scheduled for August 31, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Jason Lamar Smith not in court, defendant in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for status in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Status conference scheduled for August 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Level 5 Supervision.  
Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he/she may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he/she meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).

Defendant Jason Lamar Smith in court with attorney Ashley Fard.  Defendant Jason Lamar Smith in custody.  Michael J. Odden appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Jason Lamar Smith appeared by video means with Attorney.  Deputy Court Clerk: SD.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kies, Branch 45. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defense enters a plea of NOT GUILTY as to misdemeanor count(s).  Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04, parties are hereby notified that as of July 30, 2022, this case will be assigned to Branch 19, Judge Kori Ashley, in Room 313 of the Safety Building.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
